intro: Hieracium praevenosifrons, commonly known as the narrow-veined hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped with prominent veins, and the flowers are yellow, arranged in a flat-topped cluster. It is often found in open habitats and can spread through both seeds and rhizomes.
